head.title: Malcolm Stewart Wed To Katherine M. Boyle

hedline.hl1: Malcolm Stewart Wed To Katherine M. Boyle

block.p: LEAD: Katherine Marie Boyle, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Leonard Boyle of Rumson, N.J., was married yesterday to Malcolm James Stewart, a son of James Donald Stewart of Randolph, Vt., and the late Thelma Stewart. The Rev. Victor R. Yanitelli performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St.

LEAD: Katherine Marie Boyle, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Leonard Boyle of Rumson, N.J., was married yesterday to Malcolm James Stewart, a son of James Donald Stewart of Randolph, Vt., and the late Thelma Stewart. The Rev. Victor R. Yanitelli performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St.

Katherine Marie Boyle, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Leonard Boyle of Rumson, N.J., was married yesterday to Malcolm James Stewart, a son of James Donald Stewart of Randolph, Vt., and the late Thelma Stewart. The Rev. Victor R. Yanitelli performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York.

The bride, an account executive at Scali, McCabe, Sloves, an advertising agency in New York, graduated from Miss Porter's School and Georgetown University. Her father is a real-estate salesman at Wm. H. Hintlemann in Rumson and a member of the New Jersey Supreme Court Advisory Committee on Judicial Conduct. He was formerly the president and publisher of The Hudson Dispatch newspaper in Union City, N.J.

Mr. Stewart is a vice president in the corporate finance division of the Citicorp Investment Bank in New York. He graduated from the University of Oregon, where he was elected to Phi Beta Kappa, and received a master's degree in international affairs from Columbia University. His father, who is retired, was a professor of biology at the University of Vermont and Norwich University and a biologist for the Vermont Fish and Wildlife Department.
